intro: Trigonostemon leucanthus var. hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with a hard coat. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
